source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Polygonaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Polygonaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Erect herb, not rooting from lower nodes; leaves much reduced and bract-like in upper (flowering) part; lower leaves soon deciduous after flowering
Prostrate to decumbent herbs, commonly mat-forming, stems often rooting at nodes; leaves not markedly different in flowering region, usually persistent
Leaves linear-oblong to narrowly elliptic; lateral veins not visible; margins mostly strongly recurved; stems to c. 15 cm long, with minutely verrucose ridges when young; nut smooth and shining
Leaves narrowly elliptic to narrowly ovate; lateral veins visible on lower surface; margins not or rarely recurved; stems to c. 100 cm long, with smooth ridges when young; nut minutely roughened
Leaves more or less equal throughout; largest leaves 5–20 mm long
Leaves of lateral branches markedly smaller than (usually c. half as long as) those of main stem(s); largest leaves 20–50 mm long
